DOC.brief_summary: In this study safety and efficacy of oral morphine sulphate is evaluated in order to reduce opioids administration during major urological surgery
DOC.brief_title: Preemptive Analgesia With Morphine Sulphate in Major Urological Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The administration of oral morphine sulfate could be useful to reduce the use of opioids in major urological surgery. This study aims to assess the safety and efficacy of two different oral morphine sulphate doses 0,2 mg/kg vs 0,4mg/kg in major urological surgery.
DOC.criteria: American Society of Anaesthesiologists physical status classification I/ II, age between 18 75, BMI 18 30 American Society of Anaesthesiologists physical status classification III/ IV, renal and hepatic insufficiency, postoperative nausea and vomiting after oral opioids administrations, neurological and psychiatric disorders.
